abstract: Protests are gaining momentum in Algeria against pilot program to tap shale gas reserves; government views program as means of staving off budget crisis as oil prices fall, but protesters harbor environmental concerns related to fracking along with anticolonial resentments and sense that wealth from shale gas will not come to them.
lead_paragraph: In Algeria, a country dependent on its oil and gas reserves, daily protests against a pilot shale gas project have turned into a national antifracking movement.

headline.main: Shale Gas Project Encounters Determined Foes Deep in Algerian Sahara
headline.print_headline: Shale Gas Project Encounters Persistent Foes Deep in Algerian Sahara

snippet: In Algeria, a country dependent on its oil and gas reserves, daily protests against a pilot shale gas project have turned into a national antifracking movement.
